title: Looking for volunteer for professional profile
content:
My name is Reid Anderson and I teach Graphic Design at Durham College. If any owners of a type foundry are interested in being interviewed for a professional profile in a text book I am writing, can they please send me an e-mail through Typophile or by sending an e-mail to: [reid.anderson@durhamcollege.ca](mailto:reid.anderson@durhamcollege.ca)

The interview would take about an hour.

_Hope to hear from some of you._

 [‹ Ever been to Normandy?](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205035117/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14282 "Go to previous forum topic") [1912 Font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205035117/http:/www.typophile.com/node/14261 "Go to next forum topic")
author: reid anderson

comments.content:
Hey, I am really surprised that no one has replied to this. There must be a few of you who could volunteer one hour. It could turn out to be a good way to publicize your work. Anyways, think about it. I am still looking.

Reid

Reid, many owners of type foundries, especially larger ones, do not read every Typophile thread. I would suggest e-mailing them directly. The heads of Linotype, FontShop, E+F, URW++, TypeBox, Porchez Typofonderie, etc. all give interviews for publications on a regular basis, so I’m sure that they would respond favorably to your book if you would ask them.

\_\_  
 [www.typeoff.de](http://web.archive.org/web/20080205035117/http:/www.typeoff.de/ "www.typeoff.de")

Ok, thanks Dan. I will do that.

Reid
